numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Nigeria is a poor country.
2. India is a poor country.
3. Ethiopia is a poor country.
4. Bangladesh is a poor country.
5. In these countries, a higher percentage of the population thinks optimistically.
6. France is a more developed nation.
7. Spain is a more developed nation.
8. In these nations, the level of pessimism is higher.
9. In these nations, the level of pessimism is especially high among older generations.
10. Japan has a high level of pessimism among older generations.
11. Japan has a lower level of pessimism among younger generations.
12. I wonder why Japan has this difference between older generations and younger generations.
13. Indonesia is an outlier in the graph.
14. Indonesia is not fully developed.
15. The United States is more developed than Indonesia.
16. Many European countries are more developed than Indonesia.
17. I wonder why Indonesia is an outlier in the graph.
18. The graph omits people who are 25 to 39 years old.
19. I wonder why the graph omits people who are 25 to 39 years old.
20. The graph lists the United States as the US.
21. I am an American.
22. The graph relates to me and my community.
23. I am part of the younger generation.
24. Statistically, Americans in the younger generation are more optimistic than people in some first-world countries.
25. Germany is a first-world country.
26. Japan is a first-world country.
27. Spain is a first-world country.
28. The graph shows levels of optimism among younger generations and older generations.
29. A younger person is a person who is 15 to 24 years old.
30. An older person is a person who is older than 40 years old.
31. The graph contains a line with value 1.
32. The line with value 1 indicates equal thinking of younger people and older people.
33. If a country is further from the line with value 1, then the disparity between younger people and older people is larger.
34. The title is: The surprising reality of optimism around the world.
